result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeff M Stasiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Walworth County Case 19CF44 and Racine County Cases 19CF1405, 19CF202, 20CF1535

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Judgement for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures -Returned as Undeliverable
Letter to Judge in regards to JOC

Defendant Jeff M Stasiak in court.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Jeff M Stasiak. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant makes statement. Court gives warning to deportation, Firearm Possession and voting ineligibility.

State's Letter to Court re Defendant's Prison sentences
*Court's response - Ok. So judgment of conviction should read *consecutive to (and list four files including county).

Defendant Jeff M Stasiak appeared by video, in custody from KMCI.  Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared by phone for Jeff M Stasiak.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for pre-trial conference on all files - 20CT439 & 22CF76 with traffic cases tracking - 20TR3742 & 20TR3743. Record by the State that they are ready to proceed. Record by Atty. Compton who asks for reset due to health issues. Record by the Defendant who objects to any reset and needs to get matters done so he can enter programming scheduled to start in July. Court addresses defendant as to options. Response to Courts' questions by the defendant. Response by the State the defendant is not in custody on Walworth charges and adjournment as to speedy demand. Further discussion. Court will leave the trial on for now to allow Atty. Compton to go over options with the defendant.
Defense Letter to Judge in re appearing by phone for 6/15 hearing

Defendant Jeff M Stasiak appeared by video from Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Jeff M Stasiak.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:07 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on 22CF76 and statuses on other files - 20CT439, 20TR3742, 20TR3743. Record by Atty. Compton who has gone over the charges and penalties in the information and waives further reading. Atty. enters not guilty pleas as to 22CF76 and demands speedy trial. Oral motion by the State as to joinder. No objection by Atty Compton. Files joined for trial. Court sets for speedy trial. Court in recess.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeff M Stasiak appeared in court, in custody by video from Kettle Moraine. Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared in court for Jeff M Stasiak. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Speedy demand e-filed today by Defense but doesn't go into effect until after ARGN. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeff M Stasiak appeared in custody by video from Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared in court for Jeff M Stasiak, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:18 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance on 22CF76, and status on 20CT439. Citations, 20TR3743 and 20TR3742 are tracking. Record by Atty. Compton as to matter and asks that felony file be set for waiver of preliminary hearing. Court sets as requested with other files to track to that date. Court in recess.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CF76, 20CF482 & 20CT439
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH V.A.N. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Attorney Stephen M Compton appeared.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was moved to another facility for a different hearing. Defendant's appearance waived today. Bond in 20CF485 now covers this file. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
